result.execSummary:
The defendant Valinda Rae Hermanson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Complete counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.
No physical discipline of the victim.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due with interest. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Statement as to Negotiated Plea

3:22 PM - case called.  Defendant Valinda Rae Hermanson in court.  Attorney David Gardner Casey in court for Valinda Rae Hermanson.  Attorney Kristopher Ellis in court for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by the Atty Casey regarding plea agreement.  State moves to amend Count 2 to misdemeanor battery.  Court grants motion to Count 2 to 940.19(1).  Court questions Atty Casey/Defendant.  Responses by Atty Casey/Defendant.  Plea to amended Count 2 is no contest.  Waiver of rights and tendering plea.  Waiver free and voluntary.  Factual basis exits for plea.  Found guilty by the Court.  Court questions if there are any victims appearing that wish to be heard - no response.  Statement by Atty Ellis/Atty Casey/Defendant/Court regarding sentencing.  Court orders s/w 12 months probation with conditions of probation being complete counseling as recommended by Probation Agent, no physical discipline of the victim and cc/sc.  5 days sentence credit if revoked from probation.  Post conviction rights given.
